comments.body: parameters is more standard ansible usage than options.  Not sure if parameter values is where we use C() but it seems to map best to what was there already so I think it's fine to keep using that until someone raises an objection.
albertom pointed out that in the yaml, the field is called options so I see where that usage comes from now.  that seems okay.
Using option instead of parameter is more in accordance with the `DOCUMENTATION` block where all **options** are under the `options:` map key.
I think it's better to call it "option name" and "option value" instead of "option" and "parameter". It's clearer, at least for non-english people.

+1 to  "option name" and "option value"

So if I'm reading your proposed change correctly that would give the following examples

      Or if not set the environment variable C(ACME_PASSWORD) will be used.
      ...
      Required if I(state=present) # What about this case, when it's a mix of option name & value?
      ...
      Mutually exclusive with I(project_src) and I(files).
      ...
      See also M(win_copy) or M(win_template).
      ...
      See U(https://www.ansible.com/tower) for an overview.

I'm working on https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/21021 at the moment to improve this.

@jtyr Are you happy with:
`Required if I(state=present)`
Using `Required if I(state=present)` is fine. `Required if I(state=present)` could also be replaced by `Required if I(state) is C(preset)`.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +47,51 @@    * Requirements should be documented, using the `requirements=[]` field.
    * Author should be set, with their name and their github id, at the least.
    * Ensure that you make use of `U()` for URLs, `I()` for option names, `C()` for files and option values, `M()` for module names.
    * If an optional parameter is sometimes required this need to be reflected in the documentation, e.g. "Required when C(state=present)."
    * Verify that a GPL 3 License header is included.
